intro: Sebastiania pachyphylla, commonly known as the thick-leaved sebastiania, is a species of flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many plants with distinctive floral structures. The plant is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves that help it retain moisture in arid environments. It produces small, clustered yellow flowers that are often surrounded by green bracts. This species is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
